result.execSummary:
The defendant Codey J Byers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Codey J Byers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Codey J Byers was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: W/H adjudication on ct 1. If def successfully completes probation, ct 1 will be dismissed.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim. Not to be at Visions.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
